headline: Jerome Karle, Nobelist for Crystallography, Dies at 94
snippet: Dr. Karle shared the 1985 Nobel Prize in Chemistry with a former college classmate for creating what is now an essential tool in the development of new drugs.
name: Jerome Karle

headline: Bobby Rogers, Sang in the Miracles, Dies at 73
snippet: Mr. Rogers was born in the same hospital on the same day as Smokey Robinson, with whom he harmonized in high school and in the Hall of Fame singing group the Miracles.
name: Bobby Rogers

headline: Wojciech Inglot, Polish Cosmetics Maker, Dies at 57
snippet: Mr. Inglot developed a “breathable” nail polish that found an unexpected market among Muslim women.
name: Wojciech Inglot

headline: Rem Vyakhirev, Former Chief of Gazprom, Dies at 78
snippet: Mr. Vyakhirev, as chief executive of the huge Russian energy company during the 1990s, resisted efforts by reformers to break up and privatize it.
name: Rem Vyakhirev

headline: Vincent Sombrotto, Who Led Postal Strike, Dies at 89
snippet: After the wildcat strike in 1970, Mr. Sombrotto went on to lead one of the nation’s most powerful postal workers’ unions.
name: Vincent Sombrotto

headline: Charles M. Vest, 72, President of M.I.T. and a Leader in Online Education, Dies
snippet: Dr. Vest was trained as a mechanical engineer and became a champion of women in science and engineering.
name: Charles M. Vest

headline: Walter De Maria, Artist on Grand Scale, Dies at 77
snippet: Mr. De Maria, whose art helped give rise to earthworks, Conceptual Art and Minimal art, was best known for large-scale outdoor works, including “The Lightning Field” in New Mexico.
name: Walter De Maria

headline: Ron Motley, Who Tackled Big Tobacco, Dies at 68
snippet: Mr. Motley helped lead litigation in the early 1990s on the health consequences of smoking, leading to the largest civil settlement in American history: $246 billion.
name: Ron Motley

headline: Leonard Herzenberg, 81, Immunologist Who Revolutionized Research, Dies
snippet: Dr. Herzenberg, who developed a device to better examine cells, helped facilitate stem cell research and advance the treatment of cancer and other illnesses.
name: Leonard Herzenberg

headline: Eiji Toyoda, Promoter of the Toyota Way and Engineer of Its Growth, Dies at 100
snippet: Mr. Toyoda, the nephew of the Toyota group’s founder, was the architect of the company’s “lean manufacturing” method, which helped turn the automaker into a global powerhouse.
name: Eiji Toyoda

headline: Rawleigh Warner Jr., Brash Chairman of Mobil, Dies at 92
snippet: Mr. Warner steered the company through the Arab oil embargo of 1973, lurches in the oil market and ever more delicate dealings with oil-producing nations.
name: Rawleigh Warner Jr.

headline: Paul Reichmann, Who Helped Develop the World Financial Center, Dies at 83
snippet: Mr. Reichmann took enormous business risks, made and lost billions of dollars and built extensively in Toronto, New York and London.
name: Paul Reichmann

headline: André Schiffrin, Publishing Force and a Founder of New Press, Is Dead at 78
snippet: Mr. Schiffrin championed the work of Jean-Paul Sartre, Günter Grass, Studs Terkel, Michel Foucault, Simone de Beauvoir, Noam Chomsky and many others.
name: André Schiffrin

headline: Zvonko Busic, 67, Croatian Hijacker, Dies
snippet: Mr. Busic was a Croatian nationalist who in 1976 hijacked a Trans World Airlines flight out of La Guardia Airport and planted a bomb beneath Grand Central Terminal that killed a police officer.
name: Zvonko Busic
